title: Creating Psychological Safety
content: Psychological safety enables assertive communication. People must believe they won't be punished or humiliated for speaking up. Leaders create this through consistent positive responses to input, admitting their own errors, and never retaliating against messengers.

mcq.question: A team member raised a concern that turned out to be unfounded. How should you respond?

options.A: Explain why they were wrong so they learn
options.B: Thank them for speaking up and explain the situation

mcq.explanation: Every response to speaking up shapes future behavior. Thanking them reinforces the behavior you want. Explaining provides learning without punishment. Making them feel foolish ensures silence next time—when they might be right.

openQuestions: How does your team respond to concerns that turn out to be unfounded?
What signals indicate whether your team feels safe speaking up?
